info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 30 at 2:35PM EDT until June 1 at 2:40PM EDT by NWS Louisville KY
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Louisville KY has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Kentucky...
Stoner Creek at Paris affecting Bourbon County.
.Heavy rain from the past 24 hours has caused the river to rise.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Stoner Creek at Paris.
* WHEN...Until early Sunday afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Water floods a few low roads on right bank of creek. At 20.0 feet, Water enters yards of homes downstream of water plant. Parts of the Garrard Park flood.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:15 PM EDT Friday the stage was 16.6 feet. - Bankfull stage is 18.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 19.2 feet late tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 19.2 feet on 12/13/2007. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk.
The next statement will be issued by Saturday afternoon at 200 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SUNDAY AFTERNOON
